title: Hallmark Could Decorate Your Home to Look Like One of Its Holiday Movies—Here's How
text:
From House Beautiful

Lets be real now: Everyone has some sort of holiday-season bucket list, and for many people, that includes having the best Christmas decorations in your neighborhood. While we all know getting into the spirit of the season is not a competition, you also want to create a festive home that really captures the magic of the holidays. And also, it wouldn't be so bad if everyone you knew raved that your decor looked straight out of a Hallmark movie. Well, now it could be.

The Hallmark Channel has officially launched their annual Holiday Home Decoration Sweepstakes, where you can win a chance for the television network to decorate both the inside and outside of your home—for free. They are working with Balsam Hills, a Christmas decor company, to give home in the U.S. the opportunity to look like all the heartwarming, twinkly-light-covered, giant-ornamented-tree-bedecked houses you see in every Hallmark Christmas movie.

Photo credit: Rob Lewine - Getty Images More

Wondering how this could be your house this year? Psh, it's almost too easy to sign up. All you have to do is fill out a short application—that will only ask for your name, email address and zip code—in order to get a chance to revamp your abode. (You can earn an additional entry by creating a holiday scene on Hallmark's website, which you'll see just below the entry form.) You have now until 10 a.m. on September 23 to enter the raffle.

Once entries have closed, 25 finalists will be chosen at random, and that's where things get interesting: You'll be asked to fill out some forms and submit at least five photos of your home, according to the giveaway's rules. The top 25 will eventually be narrowed to five finalists, chosen by a team of judges, and from there, the public will help choose the grand-prize winner, who will get the interior and exterior of their home tricked out to look like the set of a holiday movie.

Your Christmas miracle—and bragging rights—await! You can enter the sweepstakes here.
